messages.content:
You are tasked with adding English translations to a set of stakeholder quotes. For each quote:
- If the quote is in English, add "N.A." as the translation
- If the quote is in any other language, provide an accurate English translation

Input format is a markdown table with stakeholder names and quotes.
Output should be a markdown table with three columns: name, original quote, and translation.

IMPORTANT RULES:
- Never translate English quotes to English - use "N.A." instead.
- Only and always translate non-English quotes.
- If the original quote, in the third column of the md table is not in english, translate it and add the translation in the 4th column, as described below, but that is only when the quote is not in English.
- Keep original quotes exactly as they are.
- Maintain the markdown table format, without including any horizontal divider lines

Example input:
| Pierre Dupont | Consumer | "Cette décision est importante." |
| John Smith | Fortescue's corporate lawyer | "We need to review this carefully." |

Example output:
| Pierre Dupont | Consumer | "Cette décision est importante." | "This decision is important." |
| John Smith | Fortescue's corporate lawyer | "We need to review this carefully." | N.A. |

Example input:
| [Person Name 1] | Person Role 1 | [Original Quote in another language (e.g. Dutch, French, German, Spanish,eyc..)] |
| [person Name 2] | Person Role 2 | [Original Quote in English] |

Example output:
| [person Name 1] | Person Role 1 | [Original Quote in another language (e.g. Dutch, French, German, Spanish,etc..)] | [Translated Quote] |
| [person Name 2] | Person Role 2 | [Original Quote in English] | N.A. |

If the input is "None", return "None". if the original quote is not in English, make sure it is translated. Add "N.A" if the quote is already in English.

Input quotes:
| Andrew Forrest | Fortescue's founder | "I am not aware of any reason why it was necessary to conduct surveillance on Mr Master-man, given Mr Masterman was not a recipient of a search order." |
| Bart Kolodziejczyk | Former Fortescue executive | "Based on my review of the surveillance reports, I believe additional surveillance was carried out on Mr Masterman that has not been disclosed by Fortescue." |
| Michael Masterman | Former Fortescue lieutenant | "The surveillance reports indicate that surveillance was conducted on Mr Masterman's residential premises in Sydney and Perth, as well as surveillance on Mr Masterman personally." |
| Bjorn Winther-Jensen | Former Fortescue executive | "Surveillance operatives followed Dr Kolodziejczyk closely including to his son's daycare … and Dr Winther-Jensen to parks, shopping centres and to a cancer awareness charity event." |

| Andrew Forrest | Fortescue's founder | "I am not aware of any reason why it was necessary to conduct surveillance on Mr Master-man, given Mr Masterman was not a recipient of a search order." | N.A. |
| Bart Kolodziejczyk | Former Fortescue executive | "Based on my review of the surveillance reports, I believe additional surveillance was carried out on Mr Masterman that has not been disclosed by Fortescue." | N.A. |
| Michael Masterman | Former Fortescue lieutenant | "The surveillance reports indicate that surveillance was conducted on Mr Masterman's residential premises in Sydney and Perth, as well as surveillance on Mr Masterman personally." | N.A. |
| Bjorn Winther-Jensen | Former Fortescue executive | "Surveillance operatives followed Dr Kolodziejczyk closely including to his son's daycare … and Dr Winther-Jensen to parks, shopping centres and to a cancer awareness charity event." | N.A. |
